forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Partly cloudy. Low around 48, with temperatures rising to around 50 overnight. West northwest wind around 7 mph.

forecast.name: Tuesday
forecast.detailedForecast: Sunny. High near 62, with temperatures falling to around 60 in the afternoon. Northwest wind around 8 mph.

weather_report:
As night unfolds over Downtown San Francisco, a tranquil veil of partly cloudy skies cradles the city, with the temperature settling comfortably at around 48 degrees. The coolness is subtly stirred by a gentle west-northwest breeze drifting at seven miles per hour, reminding us of the ever-present maritime influence. In the stillness of the night, a thick marine layer remains obscured but is likely lingering near the coastline, casting a soft haze. This slight obscurity hints at the fog that might embrace the Golden Gate Bridge through the early hours, though it is expected to give way to clearer skies come morning.

Tomorrow promises a sunny spectacle, with temperatures rising to near 62 during the day, only to gently dip again as the afternoon advances. It will be a day where the golden sun bathes the iconic city in warmth, encouraging wanderers to wrap themselves in layers that can be easily adjusted to the changing climatic embrace. A light jacket remains prudent, particularly for early morning excursions or evening strolls along the bay when the fog may return, reminding us of its whimsical dance. With this gentle shift in temperatures, tomorrow is ripe for leisurely walks through the bustling streets or perhaps savoring a peaceful coffee in one of the many charming cafes dotting the Tenderloin district, where sublime moments await amid the city’s vibrant rhythm.
